bitfield.description: This read-only register contains the revision ID for the encoder. The revision ID will identify different revisions of the IP.

Closed caption status for even Field.This bit is set immediately after the data in registers LINE21_E0 and LINE21_E1 have been encoded to closed caption. This bit is reset when both of these registers are written.

Closed Caption Status for Odd Field.This bit is set immediately after the data in registers LINE21_O0 and LINE21_O1 have been encoded to closed caption. This bit is reset when both of these registers are written.
Field Sequence ID.For PAL, all three FSQ[2:0] are used whereas for NTSC only FSQ[1:0] is meaningful. Furthermore, FSQ[0] represents odd field when it is 0 and even field when it is 1.

register.description: This register specifies the input video source and format

bitenum.description: Reset the encoder, after reset, this bit is automatically set to zero.
The input RGB data are in binary format with coding range 0-255The input YCrCb data are in binary format with coding range 0-255
The input RGB data are in binary format with coding range 16-235The input YCrCb data are in binary format conforming to ITU-601 standard

bitfield.description: These two bits specify the video input data stream format and timing

bitenum.description: 27 MHz, 2x oversampling, the last 2x oversampling filter bypassed
Free running enabled. HSYNC and VSYNC are ignored

bitfield.description: Enable to detect F and V bits only on EAV in ITU-R 656 input mode

bitenum.description: Detection of F and V bits on both EAV and SAV
Detection of F and V bits only on EAV

bitfield.description: Ignore protection bits in ITU-R 656 input mode

bitenum.description: Internal default blanking AND internal programmable blanking defined by[24:16]FAL and [8:0] LAL bit fields. Note: in this mode, the [16] SBLANK bit must be '0b1' to active the VBLKM functionality.
Internal programmable blanking defined by[26:16] SAVID and [10:0] EAVID bit fields.
External blanking defined by and registers.

bitfield.description: LLEN[10:0]Line length or total number of pixels in a scan line including active video and blanking. Total number of pixels in a scan line = LLEN A write on the LLEN[10] is illegal.
The frame length or total number of lines in a frame including active video and blanking from the source image.Total number of lines in a frame from the source image = FLENS + 1

bitenum.description: The chrominance interpolation filter is enabled
The first section of the chrominance interpolation filter is bypassed
The second section of the chrominance interpolation filter is bypassed
Both sections of the filter are bypassed
The luminance interpolation filter is enabled
The luminance interpolation filter is bypassed

bitfield.description: Wide screen signaling run-in code frequency controlFor common values for FWSS[15:0] bit field, refer to Reset value is for NTSC-601standard
Close caption run-in code frequency controlFor common values for FCC[15:0] bit field refer to . Reset value is for NTSC-601 standard
Phase of the encoded video color subcarrier (including the color burst) relative to H-sync. The adjustable step is 360/256 degrees.

Gain control for Cb signal. Following are typical programming examples for NTSC and PAL standards. NTSC with 7.5 IRE pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 92.5 IRE GU = 0x102 NTSC with no pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 100 IRE GU = 0x117PAL with no pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 100 IRE GU = 0x111

Gain control of Cr signal. Following are typical programming examples for NTSC and PAL standards. NTSC with 7.5 IRE pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 92.5 IRE GV = 0x16CNTSC with no pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 100 IRE GV = 0x189PAL with no pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 100 IRE GV = 0x181

Gain control of Y signal. Following are typical programming examples for NTSC/PAL standards.NTSC with 7.5 IRE pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 92.5 IRE GY = 0x12FNTSC with no pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 100 IRE GY = 0x147PAL with no pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 100 IRE GY = 0x140

Black level setting. Following are typical programming examples for NTSC/PAL standards. NTSC with 7.5 IRE pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 92.5 IRE BLACK_LEVEL = 0x43 NTSC with no pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 100 IRE BLACK_LEVEL = 0x38PAL with no pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 100 IRE BLACK_LEVEL = 0x3B

Blank level setting. Following are typical programming examples for NTSC/PAL standards. NTSC with 7.5 IRE pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 92.5 IRE BLANK_LEVEL = 0x38NTSC with no pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 100 IRE BLANK_LEVEL = 0x38PAL with no pedestal: WHITE - BLACK = 100 IRE BLANK_LEVEL = 0x3B
Cross color reduction enable for composite video output. Cross color does not affect S-video output

bitenum.description: The notch is at 32.8 % of the frequency of the encoding pixel clock
The notch is at 26.5 % of the frequency of the encoding pixel clock
The notch is at 30.0 % of the frequency of the encoding pixel clock
The notch is at 29.2 % of the frequency of the encoding pixel clock

bitfield.description: These three bits can be used for chroma channel delay compensation. Delay on Luma channel.

bitenum.description: PAL switch phase is inverted compared to nominal
-6db at 21.8 % of encoding pixel clock frequency
-6db at 19.8 % of encoding pixel clock frequency
-6db at 18.0 % of encoding pixel clock frequency
-6db at 23.7 % of encoding pixel clock frequency
-6db at 26.8 % of encoding pixel clock frequency

bitfield.description: The value of this field and the SQP bit in theVENC_BSTAMP_WSS_DATA[7] SQP bit control the number of horizontal pixels displayed per scan lineMode: Configuration: . ITU-R 601 NTSC SQP = 0, FFRQ = 1, Number of pixels by line = 858 . Square pixel NTSC SQP = 1, FFRQ = 1, Number of pixels by line = 780 . ITU-R 601 PAL SQP = 0, FFRQ = 0, Number of pixels by line = 864 . Square pixel PAL SQP = 1, FFRQ = 0, Number of pixels by line = 944 .

WSS data [19:0]: Wide Screen Signaling dataNTSC: WORD 0 WSS_D1, WSS_D0 . WORD 1 WSS_D5, WSS_D4, WSS_D3, WSS_D2 . WORD 2 WSS_D13, WSS_D12, WSS_D11, WSS_D10, WSS_D9, WSS_D8, WSS_D7, WSS_D6 . CRC WSS_D19, WSS_D18, WSS_D17, WSS_D16, WSS_D15, WSS_D14 . PAL: GROUP A WSS_D3, WSS_D2, WSS_D1, WSS_D0 . GROUP B WSS_D7, WSS_D6, WSS_D5, WSS_D4 . GROUP C WSS_D10, WSS_D9, WSS_D8 . GROUP D WSS_D13, WSS_D12, WSS_D11 .
Square-pixel sampling rate. Please refer toVENC_M_CONTROL[0] FFRQ bit description for programming information.
Setting of amplitude of color burst.

These four bytes' data program the color subcarrier frequency and are determined by the following formula.S_CARR = ROUND((Fsc/Fclkenc) * 2)Where: Fsc = Frequency of the subcarrierFclkenc = Frequency of the internal video encoding clock = 2*LLEN *FhLLEN = Number of pixels in a scan line. For LLEN setting, please refer to the description of VENC_LLEN register (offset 0x1C).Fh = Line frequencyFor typical setting of the FSC field, refer to .

The two bytes of the closed caption data in the even field. For a complete field description, refer to CEA-608-x standard.For data stream content, see ,[31:24] First byte of data . [23:16] Second byte of data .

The two bytes of the closed caption data in the odd field. For a complete field description, refer to CEA-608-x standard.For data stream content, see ,[15:8] First byte of data . [7:0] Second byte of data .
The two bytes of the closed caption run in code position from the HSYNC.

Selects the line where closed caption or extended service data are encoded.The value of the SLINE[4:0] bit field depends on the video standard: . PAL mode: Because there is a one-line offset, program the desired line number – 1. To activate the closed caption on line 21 (0x15), program the value 0x15 – 1 = 0x14. The default value is 0x15 + 1 = 0x16 (line 22). . NTSC mode: Because there is a four-line offset, program the desired line number – 4. To activate the closed caption on line 21 (0x15), program the value 0x15 – 4 = 0x11. The default value is 0x15 + 4 = 0x19 (line 25). .
This bit controls the WSS encoding.

Selects the line where WSS data are encoded. The LINE[12:8] bit field value depends on the video standard:PAL mode: There is an one line offset, so program the wanted line number - 1. The recommended value is line 0x16 + 1 = 0x17 (23rd line). The default value is 0x14 + 1 = 0x15 (line 21).NTSC mode: There is a four line offset, so program the wanted line number - 4. The recommended value is line 0x10 + 4 = 0x14 (20th line). The default value is 0x14 + 4 = 0x18 (line 24).
Those bits controls the Line21 closed caption encoding according to the mode.
Vertical trigger reference for VSYNC. These bits specify the phase between VSYNC input and the lines in a field. The VTRIG field is expressed in units of half-line.
Horizontal trigger phase, which sets HSYNC. HTRIG is expressed in half-pixels or clk2x (27 MHz) periods
End of active video. These bits define the ending pixel position on a horizontal display line where active video will be displayed.
Start of active video. These bits define the starting pixel position on a horizontal line where active video will be displayed.
First Active Line of Field. These bits define the first active line of a field
Field length. These bits define the number of half_lines in each field.Length of field = (FLEN + 1) half_lines

bitenum.description: Reset every eight fields. Color subcarrier phase is reset to VENC_CPHASE[7:0] CPHS field value (offset 0x2C) upon reset
Reset every four fields. Color subcarrier phase is reset to VENC_CPHASE[7:0] CPHS bit field value (offset 0x2C) upon reset
Enables the output of data when[10] VBLMK bit is '0b1'.

bitfield.description: Last Active Line of Field. These bits define the last active line of a field. The LAL[8:0] bit field value must be set to a value lower than the active window.
HSYNC internal stop. These bits define HSYNC internal stop pixel value
HSYNC internal start. These bits define HSYNCI NTERNAL start pixel value
HSYNC external stop. These bits define HSYNC external stop pixel value
HSYNC external start. These bits define HSYNC EXTERNAL start pixel value
VSYNC internal start. These bits define VSYNC internal start pixel value.
VSYNC internal start. These bits define VSYNC INTERNAL start line value
VSYNC internal stop. These bits define VSYNC internal stop pixel value
VSYNC external start. These bits define VSYNC external start pixel value.
VSYNC internal stop. These bits define VSYNC INTERNAL stop line value.
VSYNC external start. These bits define VSYNC EXTERNAL start line value.
VSYNC external stop. These bits define VSYNC EXTERNAL stop pixel value.
VSYNC external stop. These bits define VSYNC EXTERNAL stop line value.
AVID stop. These bits define AVID stop pixel value
AVID start. These bits define AVID start pixel value
AVID stop. These bits define AVID stop line value.
AVID start. These bits define AVID start line value
FID internal start. These bits define FID internal start line value
FID internal start. These bits define FID internal start pixel value
FID external start. These bits define FID external start pixel value
FID internal offset. These bits define FID internal offset linel value
FID external offset. These bits define FID external offset line value
FID external start. These bits define FID external start line value.

register.description: TV Detection Start and Stop pixel values

bitfield.description: TVDETGP internal stop. These bits define TVDETGP internal stop pixel value.
TVDETGP internal start. These bits define TVDETGP internal start pixel value

register.description: TV detection Start and Stop line values

bitfield.description: TVDETGP internal stop. These bits define TVDETGP internal stop line value.
TVDETGP internal start. These bits define TVDETGP internal start line value.

register.description: TVDETGP enable and SYNC_POLARITY and UVPHASE_POL
Output channel control register Also contains some test control features

bitfield.description: In test mode, DAC 1 input value(if s-video video mode is selected)
Source of chroma video data in test mode

bitenum.description: Chroma test data comes from internal register OUTPUT_TEST[25:16]
Chroma test data comes from display controller video port G[1:0], B[7:0]

bitfield.description: Source of composite video data in test mode

bitenum.description: Composite test data comes from internal register OUTPUT_TEST[9:0]
Composite test data comes from display controller video port G[1:0], B[7:0]

bitfield.description: Source of luminance video data in test mode

bitenum.description: Luma test data comes from internal register OUTPUT_CONTROL[25:16]
Luma test data comes from display controller video port G[1:0], B[7:0]

bitfield.description: This enables the video DACs to be tested. The values sent to the DACs comes from a register for each output channel (Luma, Composite or Chroma) or from the display controller video port bits G[1:0], B[7:0], depending on the setting of the Source bits

bitenum.description: Video outputs are in normal operation
Test mode. Video outputs are directly connected to either internal registers or the display controller video port.

bitfield.description: Controls the video output polarity. This may be used to correct for inversion in an external video amplifier.

register.description: Test values for the Luma/Composite Video DAC1 (if composite video is selected) and the Chroma Video DAC2

bitfield.description: In test mode, DAC 2 input value
In test mode, DAC 1 input value (if composite video is selected)
